content:
An incident manager at Take-Out notices a spike in customer cases about errors with a new marketing discount code. The manager creates an incident record, links related cases, assigns the incident to a team member, and launches a flow to update case ownership.

A team member searches for knowledge articles but can't find any known workarounds. They start a swarm in Slack with other experts using the Begin Swarming flow and Expert Finder. As a team, they localize the issue, identify impacted customers, and invite DevOps members to collaborate on resolution.

The DevOps team creates a problem record to capture details and investigate the root cause. They debug the issue, identify assets, and link the problem to the incident. A team member adds a broadcast banner to alert users about the incident and offers an alternate discount code.

As soon as the bug is identified, a team member creates a change request to capture resolution steps. The DevOps team creates a work plan, outlines steps, and gets sign-off from the Change Advisory Board.

After the fix is approved and the incident resolved, the team launches a flow to close related records. The incident owner removes the banner, sends a broadcast email, and closes the swarm, celebrating their collaboration.
title: Incident Management with Service Cloud
